divs: Sighting DetailsOn Saturday night of Saturday July 3, 2010 starting at about 9:20 P.M. CST several of us observed orange glowing balls moving in formations of two and three. As the first group disappeared, another group would follow in about five minutes. They appeared to be following the Lake Michigan shoreline from south to north and then gaining altitude and turning out over the Lake to the northeast. There must have been twelve in all. While they appeared to be about a mile east of our position and about 2,000 feet up, we did not hear engine noise. They appeared to be floating until one gained on the other's position in the first group.
Summary: Slow moving orange balls over the Lake Michigan shoreline at Sheboygan, WI.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Sheboygan
There were no other sightings in Sheboygan on or around July 3rd 2010
